title: Malargüe: A satellite dish best served cold
summary: A capacity increase by almost 80%! In late July 2024, the Malargüe deep-space communication station completed an important upgrade of its antenna feed that will allow missions to send much more data back to Earth.

title: RFA Granted Launch Licence for RFA ONE Debut from SaxaVord
summary:
The UK Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) has issued Rocket Factory Augsburg with a vertical launch licence to conduct the inaugural flight of its RFA ONE rocket from SaxaVord Spaceport in Scotland. RFA is developing a three-stage rocket called RFA ONE, designed to deliver payloads of up to 1,300 kilograms to low Earth orbit. In 2024, […]

title: EarthCARE goes live with data now available to all
summary: With ESA’s EarthCARE satellite and four measuring instruments all working extremely well and fully commissioned, the mission’s ‘first level’ data stream is now freely available.

title: Blue Origin reaches orbit on first flight of its titanic New Glenn rocket
summary: Bypassing engine chill issues and a wayward boat, Blue Origin got to T-0.

title: New Glenn reaches orbit on first launch
summary:
Blue Origin’s New Glenn rocket achieved orbit on its long-awaited first launch Jan. 16, although the company failed in its attempt to recover the first stage.

title: Second SAR satellite advances Space42’s hybrid connectivity and imagery vision
summary:
